title: Companies Falter in Making Diversity and Inclusion a C-Suite Job
text:
When Dow Inc. named Karen S. Carter as chief inclusion officer in 2017, the chemical company became only the fifth member of the S&P 500 to elevate such a role to the C-suite. That group hasn’t grown since.

Ms. Carter, who has held various leadership roles at Dow for more than two decades, took the job knowing that the company and its 37,000 workers still had a long way to go. In its first inclusion report, published last year, Dow said that about 81% of its U.S. employees are white and 72% of its global workers are men.

...
description: D&I usually falls under human resources, but a handful of corporations are dedicating a top executive to the task.
